The Verses of the Cāṇakya Treatise
The various meanings will be spoken,
The collection of royal policies;
This treatise is the seed of all,
The essence of the Cāṇakya.
I will explain the root sutra,
As spoken by Cāṇakya;
By whom, with the intoxication of knowledge,
The wise one becomes deluded.
The wise one and the king,
Are never equal;
The king is worshipped in his own country,
The wise one is worshipped everywhere.
And all the good qualities are in the wise one,
And all the faults are in the deluded one;
Therefore, among a thousand deluded ones,
The wise one shines forth alone.🔽As with one's own mother in other women,
As with one's own wife in the wives of others;
As with oneself in all beings,
